title: Blawpaw
author: Blawpaw
content: it looks like Cristiano Ronaldo has just signed a partnership with Binance to have his own NFT collection starting from November 18.https://twitter.com/Cristiano/status/1592520297290551308?t=hSxjM5-L-rlTKnYICqeEPQ&s=19Binance is hitting strong the Footbal industry and already counts with several partnerships with many prominent players as well as Football clubs. This is good news for the industry as it brings a lot more visibility to cryptos.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: C. Ronaldo NFT collection coming on Binance and he want fans to join his Web 3 community, neither is it related to trading nor gambling, it is just about C. Ronaldo and the centralised Binance. Good luck to him if he is endorsed by Binance. I do not know much about these worthless NFTs that people are making them to worth something, isn't C. Ronaldo selling the NFTs for his own more profits?Celebrities will only gain from NFTs as some people will want to buy his iconic moments. Which means this is just about C. Ronaldo, but has nothing to do with gambling.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: This is already old news. Here is my thread on the same topic from June 24, 2022: Binance signs Cristiano Ronaldo for exclusive partnership to push NFTsOther than that, I do not see how this is related to gambling in any way.

comments.author: darkangel11
comments.body: You, old news. Nowadays nobody is going to sign up for NFTs they're mostly gone along with many exchanges that provided liquidity or so fake liquidity in some cases. The whole market for NFTs is no longer here and Christiano will have to wait for another bull run before the profits start pouring. You need an influx of new investors and another wave of FOMO to resurrect this industry and chances are it will never come back like ICOs never did.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I worry a bit that Binance is following in FTX's footsteps a little.  The only real difference between the two operations is that Binance was successful with BNB where FTX got a little overzealous and wasn't able to keep their FTT token propped up.  I hope that Binance isn't having a slow motion replay of FTX with sponsorships like this (I hear Tom Brady is free) and while Binance seems too big to fail at the moment, there were certainly people who had that opinion of FTX a week ago...  Be careful.  Just remember what exchanges do, how they should be utilized, and don't trust anyone.  This catastrophe for the market isn't over yet, and it's highly likely that there will be more failures ahead.  Don't get comfortable.

comments.author: Falconer
comments.body: Quote from: Blawpaw on November 15, 2022, 03:05:15 PMit looks like Cristiano Ronaldo has just signed a partnership with Binance to have his own NFT collection starting from November 18.https://twitter.com/Cristiano/status/1592520297290551308?t=hSxjM5-L-rlTKnYICqeEPQ&s=19I'm not entirely sure if it will lead to great success for both parties, but maybe in other ways a partnership like this will increase the visibility of the exchange. Here Ronaldo is an artist for Binance to promote his services, but on the other hand this will also make binance get a lot of profit.Quote from: Blawpaw on November 15, 2022, 03:05:15 PMBinance is hitting strong the Footbal industry and already counts with several partnerships with many prominent players as well as Football clubs. This is good news for the industry as it brings a lot more visibility to cryptos.The crypto industry has now even received a lot of attention from various types of sports. Not only football, I think there are many other sports that have partnered with the crypto industry. Obviously this would benefit both industries, but of course it would not be a guarantee that the project would be highly credible.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on November 15, 2022, 03:23:31 PMThis is already old news. Here is my thread on the same topic from June 24, 2022: Binance signs Cristiano Ronaldo for exclusive partnership to push NFTsOther than that, I do not see how this is related to gambling in any way.it is not related to gambling and it is also not related to bitcoin, this should be moved to altcoins section. I believe that with so many problems that cristiano ronaldo has at manchester united at the moment he should not be so focused on this NFT project, he is more focused on having good performances in the world cup games to be able to move to a good club and leave manchester united

comments.author: harizen
comments.body: Quote from: Blawpaw on November 15, 2022, 03:05:15 PMThis is good news for the industry as it brings a lot more visibility to cryptos.Visibility, yes but it's just another form of NFT hype. I'm not really into celebrities or popular people into NFT because of an obvious reason that it's just hype.Anyways, the Cristiano Ronaldo NFT collection is coming on November 18 as per the tweet.https://twitter.com/Cristiano/status/1592520297290551308

comments.author: W Jr.
comments.body: Quote from: harizen on November 15, 2022, 09:21:57 PMQuote from: Blawpaw on November 15, 2022, 03:05:15 PMThis is good news for the industry as it brings a lot more visibility to cryptos.Visibility, yes but it's just another form of NFT hype. I'm not really into celebrities or popular people into NFT because of an obvious reason that it's just hype.Anyways, the Cristiano Ronaldo NFT collection is coming on November 18 as per the tweet.https://twitter.com/Cristiano/status/1592520297290551308It was great that they shared this news with Cristiano Ronaldo. Binance is one of the best in the world. If Cristiano Ronaldo is going to launch an Nft, Binance will create a nice partnership as an intermediary. As I understand it, they are working on a different innovation after Fan Tokens. I'm waiting for November 18.

comments.author: fullhdpixel
comments.body: Quote from: W Jr. on November 15, 2022, 09:28:13 PMQuote from: harizen on November 15, 2022, 09:21:57 PMQuote from: Blawpaw on November 15, 2022, 03:05:15 PMThis is good news for the industry as it brings a lot more visibility to cryptos.Visibility, yes but it's just another form of NFT hype. I'm not really into celebrities or popular people into NFT because of an obvious reason that it's just hype.Anyways, the Cristiano Ronaldo NFT collection is coming on November 18 as per the tweet.https://twitter.com/Cristiano/status/1592520297290551308It was great that they shared this news with Cristiano Ronaldo. Binance is one of the best in the world. If Cristiano Ronaldo is going to launch an Nft, Binance will create a nice partnership as an intermediary. As I understand it, they are working on a different innovation after Fan Tokens. I'm waiting for November 18.It's not the news that they shared but it was a promotion and luckily Ronaldo agrees with the deal, I think that is because he was offered with good money by binance. Binance won't do that if they didn't know that they can recover what they have paid because Ronaldo is a famous personality in the field of football and his fans could easily purchase the NFT's by showing their support to the player.Those who aren't a true fan but only a fan of cryptos/nft or simply a fan of making out money through the hype will also ride the trend. Binance never stops innovating because they want to grow more. They want to dominate the crypto world.

comments.author: eaLiTy
comments.body: Quote from: Blawpaw on November 15, 2022, 03:05:15 PMit looks like Cristiano Ronaldo has just signed a partnership with Binance to have his own NFT collection starting from November 18.I heard this news in June that Cristiano Ronaldo signed with Binance to launch his NFT and now they are launching at the eve of FiFA World Cup but there is accusation from fans because Cristiano Ronaldo appeared for an interview couple of days ago accusing Manchester United owners for betraying him and so on and now when he announced this in Twitter he is getting some backlash especially from MU fans.I would say CR7 is late in launching his NFT, majority of the prominent players already launched theirs when NFT was seen as a hot topic and even Messi launched when the hype was at its peak but right now the NFT hype have died down and lets see how much they will be able to raise during the sale.

comments.author: dataispower
comments.body: They have been good partners since. I have read that new about the both sides Binance and Cristiano Ronaldo in close relationship to influence some sport fans to make use of this chance to advertise the NFT.Imagine Binance breaking with FTX and FTX.us and Cristiano Ronaldo breaking bonds with Manchester United soon, is this a coincidence or what?  Binance are also doing same with Argentina they are in a good partnership with Argentina sponsoring the National team

comments.author: LFC_Bitcoin
comments.body: He’s not having a good time at the moment, is he. That interview & his failure to get on the pitch with Man Utd. This is Ronaldo we’re talking about though, the guy is just a total winner. It wouldn’t surprise me if he goes on to have a great World Cup. Who knows what Portugal could achieve with CR7 leading the line.

comments.author: Boristhecat
comments.body: I have mixed feelings about this news. On the one hand, the release of the NFT does not oblige to anything, and in such cases it is nothing more than digital autographs. It is unlikely that if someone makes unsuccessful investments in the NFT, he will blame Ronaldo for this. On the other hand, the crypto now has a rather negative background, and such news from Ronaldo, who carefully monitors his reputation, surprised me.

comments.author: Vinaa77
comments.body: Yes. This is an extraordinary achievement made by Binance to place CR7 as Binance's NFT. We know there are a lot of CR7 fans around the world right now who are going to collect the NFT developed by Binance. This will also increase the number of Binance users in the future. CR7's twit also makes other world investors who will glance at the Binance platform to join and invest in Binance.

comments.author: Zackgeno96
comments.body: It doesn't say much when a big name commits itself to such companies and constructions. It will still yield a nice amount for Ronaldo. Although he has enough money. We have also seen this with former top football players, who then become ambassadors for a gambling site. That also means nothing. If there are problems with a site or a payout, users should not think that these celebrities are going to solve it for you. They have absolutely nothing to do with that part of the site and are only there for the image of the site towards the customers. I would almost say that you just have to pay more attention, because sites want to buy a certain reputation indirectly through such constructions.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: If this news is most recent from Ronaldo's camp, it is rather late because he would be among the last stars who I can count, that is yet to launch his own NFT.  It doesn't matter what his rift with Manchester united is, it is a matter that has been fort-coming, it is fortunate it so happened some days before the commencement of the world cup.Ronaldo has a lot of fans, and he being a personal brand will definitely hit success with this launch as with other stars who have been endorsed or launched their own NFTS.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: I also come across the update online about this and i think the exchange Binance is trying all means to get the global attention of the world in building reputation through partnership of this kind, they have been showing interest with high caliber of individuals or government in promoting their NFTs and through that making their own fame and wealth in the same way, other celebrities have had similar encounter with the same exchange.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I would have preferred Binance to sign a contract with Cristiano Ronaldo for advertisement purposes, like Cristiano appearing on a TV advertisement or something similar.I am afraid the NFT market has suffered much these last months for it to be a reliable form of advertisement. Unless this NFT was an idea by Cristiano himself?

comments.author: el kaka22
comments.body: Celebs trying to make some money out of crypto without really spending anything but their time is never really good for us. They just want our money, do not bring that much money into the market from outside, and they just use their face and take your money and that’s it.This is not a good thing for any of us, he is just trying to make money from his fame and NFT is another way of doing that, consider it the same as his shampoo commercials and nothing else because that’s the reality right now, he is only doing it because of money. NFT or binance or crypto or anything like that doesn't even matter to him, as long as he gets paid from this in the end when it’s over.
